description: Numbers that are congruent to {1, 3, 4, 5} mod 6.
comments: "Polyrhythmic Sequence" P(2,3): numbers congruent to 1 mod 2 and 1 mod 3.  (See A267027 for definition and description). - _Bob Selcoe_, Jan 12 2016
links: Colin Barker, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (2,-2,2,-1).
formula: From _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 08 2011: (Start)a(n) = 3*n/2-1/2-cos(Pi*n/2)/2.G.f.: x*(x^3+x+1)/((x-1)^2*(x^2+1)). (End)From _Colin Barker_, Oct 19 2015: (Start)a(n) = (-2-(-i)^n-i^n+6*n)/4, where i = sqrt(-1).G.f.: x*(x^3+x+1) / ((x-1)^2*(x^2+1)).(End)
prog: (PARI) a(n) = (-2-(-I)^n-I^n+6*n)/4 \\ _Colin Barker_, Oct 19 2015(PARI) Vec(x*(x^3+x+1)/((x-1)^2*(x^2+1)) + O(x^100)) \\ _Colin Barker_, Oct 19 2015(MAGMA) [n: n in [0..150]|n mod 6 in {1,3,4,5}]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jan 12 2016
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
